Home → News → Page → News

News

New video shows how libraries can improve wellbeing

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 17, 2020

A new three-minute film shows Suffolk Libraries staff, volunteers and users discussing the life-changing effects of libraries.

Local artists invited to explore the theme of gender equality with Suffolk Libraries' latest BLOC Lab

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 13, 2020

Suffolk Libraries is inviting six local artists to undertake a week-long residency at Bury St Edmunds Library from 30 March - 3 April 2020. To tie in with the British Library's newest exhibition, Unfinished Business: The Fight for Women’s Rights, the theme for the week is gender equality.

New coffee shop opens at Ipswich County Library

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 11, 2020

Enjoy a hot drink or a delicious pastry at Ipswich County Library with the opening of a new Coffeelink.

New reading list to support children’s mental health and literacy

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 7, 2020

A new ‘Reading Well for Children’ booklist has been launched for Children’s Mental Health Week.

Try something new with Suffolk Libraries' Discovereads promotion

Written by James Powell · Published Feb 7, 2020

Suffolk Libraries is launching a new reading promotion which aims to get people to read something a bit different. Discovereads is an exciting new project featuring six books handpicked by our librarians, with the help of reading groups across the county.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for March 2020

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 5, 2020

This month Lesley will be discussing The Great Level, by Stella Tillyard.

February half-term events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 4, 2020

Children and families are invited to meet animals and princesses, learn about the natural world, make arts and crafts and more this half-term.

Enjoy a magical book night with Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jan 28, 2020

Harry Potter Book Night is back this February. Libraries across Suffolk will once again be hosting events in celebration of the bestselling books by J. K. Rowling.

Suffolk Libraries and Suffolk Wildlife Trust get wild about reading

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 21, 2020

Suffolk Wildlife Trust and Suffolk Libraries are launching a new partnership project to connect the natural world and the written word and celebrate the different ways authors relate to nature.

Ipswich conference aims to help leading businesses tackle mental health issues

Written by James Powell · Published Jan 17, 2020

A conference to help businesses in the region tackle the issue of poor mental health in the workplace is taking place in Ipswich on Monday 30 March.
